name: Daily Temperatures
title: Daily Temperatures
content:
Given an array of integers temperatures represents the daily temperatures, return an array answer such that answer[i] is the number of days you have to wait after the ith day to get a warmer temperature. If there is no future day for which this is possible, keep answer[i] == 0 instead.

 

Example 1:

Input: temperatures = [73,74,75,71,69,72,76,73]
Output: [1,1,4,2,1,1,0,0]

Example 2:

Input: temperatures = [30,40,50,60]
Output: [1,1,1,0]

Example 3:

Input: temperatures = [30,60,90]
Output: [1,1,0]

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= temperatures.length <= 105
  • 30 <= temperatures[i] <= 100

discussion_posts.name: durjoyovi76

discussion_posts.name: jd_Kdcgc
discussion_posts.content:
HINT:

What can we notice in the problem?
We can see that we need the next greater element for every number, right?

What we can do is -> 
1. Make a stack and push index 0 in it  (because for index 0, we donot have any greater element right now)
2. Check for every index from 1 to n
3. If element less than this number is/are present in stack just keep on popping them and update in your answer array the difference in indexes of both of these (we want distance between index of these 2 numbers, right)
4. Push the index for which you were checking in the stack (bcoz we have not got any element greater than this element)

eg.  [73,74,75,71,69,72,76,73]

 We push 0 in stack
Now, we checked for index i = 1, its 74 and element less than it (73) is present in stack
So, we did (ans [stk.top ()} = 1 - stk.top ()) (1 is i in this case)
Now, stack is empty and we add index 1 in stack bcoz we need to find the element greater than 74
Next, for i = 2, it will be the same procedure
now, stack will have 2 (index of 75) after i = 2
Now, when we check for i = 3, i..e 71, we cant find any element greater than it in stack, so, we just push this index without popping anything
Now, after i = 3, stack has {71, 75} from top to bottom
Next, for i = 4 i.e. 69, we can see than only index 3 is greater than 69, so we pop index 3 and push the current index i.e. 4

Like this, we will work till index n
After checking till end, if stack has any indexes left, the answers for them will be 0

If you guys wanna see the implementation
https://leetcode.com/problems/daily-temperatures/submissions/861460644/

Please UPVOTE

discussion_posts.name: tejasree438
discussion_posts.content:
Lets try to understand the problem

temp  =73  74  75  71  69  72  76  73
Index =0    1   2  3   4   5   6   7

Assume that index are days
No .of days to wait warm temprature:
General analysis for the output are  [1,1,4,2,1,1,0,0]

At Index[0]=73->Need to wait one day because next warm temparature is in just next index[1]=1-0 =1days

At Index[1]=74->Need to wait one day because next warm temparature is in just next index[2]=2-1=1 days

At Index[2]=75->Need to wait four days because next warm temparature is in at index[6]= 6-1= 4 days

At Index[3]=71->Need to wait two days because next warm temparature is in at index[5]= 5-3= 2 days

At Index[4]=69->Need to wait one day because next warm temparature is in at index[5]= 5-4= 1 days

At Index[5]=72->Need to wait one day because next warm temparature is in at index[6]= 6-5= 1 days

At Index[6]=76->Its already high temparature so geater temparature than the last day temeparature .so keep it as 0.ignore. Index [6]=0 days

At Index[7]=76->Its last high temparature so other days .so keep it as 0.
 Index [7]=0 days

Then take this values in Monotonic Stack to find the higher number ,remember to come back from last day temparature as last day temp is constant.

discussion_posts.name: CyberRedPanda
discussion_posts.content: It feels as though at least half the time I use a nested loop in Python I hit a time limit exceeded error even when the algorithm is valid. I understand that it may be faster to use stack, but if using stack is a requirement to solve the problem in time, it would be nice to have some warning in the description.

discussion_posts.name: piyush4299
discussion_posts.content: Try to think of some data structure other than Array to perform the operation needed like how we can find next warmer temperature for every day. Once you know which data structure to use here then rest of it is just a piece of cake.
